question:
A unit arranges for 6 people on duty on the first day, second day, third day of the new year.They are G., H, K, L, P, and S.Two people are required per day.The personnel arrangement must meet the following conditions? (1) L and P must be on duty on the same day.(2) G and H cannot be on duty on the same day.(3) If K is on the first day of duty, then G is on the second day of duty.(4 ) If S is on the third day of duty, then H is on the second day of duty.
Which of the following can be a complete and accurate arrangement of the duty dates of these people?
A.Junior One? L and P? Junior Two? G and K? Junior Three H and S
B.First day? L and P? second day? H and K? third day G and S
C.Junior One? G and K? Junior Two? L and P? Junior Three H and S
D.Junior One? K and S? Junior Two? G and H? Junior Three L and P

cot: We need to find a personnel arrangement that meets the given conditions. Condition (1) states that L and P must be on duty on the same day. Condition (2) states that G and H cannot be on duty on the same day. Condition (3) states that if K is on the first day of duty, then G is on the second day of duty. Condition (4) states that if S is on the third day of duty, then H is on the second day of duty. We can start by analyzing the conditions and trying to find a possible arrangement. Try to find a possible arrangement that meets the conditions. Since L and P must be on duty on the same day (Condition 1), we can start by placing them together on one of the three days. Let's try placing them on the first day. This leaves two people, G, H, K, and S, to be assigned to the second and third days.
